name: Kaiharbor
role_in_state: Primary deepwater shipbuilding and long-distance trade hub
economy_niches: rope, sailcraft and metal fittings artisans
culture_adjustments: Strong guild legalism â€” contracts override some customary norms
Tide-calendar rituals tied to berthing schedules
More cosmopolitan dialects and loanwords from Island Creole crews
Heightened shipwreck memorial culture; annual wake-processions inform local identity
constraints: relies on scarce imported ritual reagents for major rites
tidal windows constrain shipyard and reagent harvest scheduling
industrial growth limited by low-pressure combustion tech and guild regulations
notes: Major node for State_6 maritime tariffs and convoy musters
Port auguries used to schedule berthing and reef-harvests, not to replace seamanship
Seasonal festivals attract migrant crews and boost short-term labor supply
